Beyond the Book

  • Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with a Lollie nominee!

    Written by Matt Shenton on Mar 24, 2016

    Come 'Beyond the Book' and meet Emily Sparkes as she tries to make sense of the mayhem around her. She will make you cry with laughter!

    Written by Matt Shenton on Mar 10, 2016

  • Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with a stunning debut novel

    Written by Matt Shenton on Mar 2, 2016

    Once a year, Teva separates into two, leaving a younger version of herself stuck at the same age. Dive into the astonishing world of 'More of Me'.

  • World Book Day Quiz

    Written by Matt Shenton on Mar 1, 2016

    Celebrate World Book Day 2016 with our fun book quiz!

  • My ‘Beyond the Book’ Bingo

    Written by Matt Shenton on Feb 29, 2016

    Fancy reading a book with a blue cover? Join us in playing 'Beyond the Book Bingo' and be introduced to some great authors and books!

  • Children’s Mental Health Week

    Written by Matt Shenton on Feb 8, 2016

    As Children's Mental Health Week begins, we look at two ways that libraries and reading can support the mental well-being of children and young people.

  • Go ‘Beyond the Book’ and back in time

    Written by Matt Shenton on Jan 29, 2016

    We travel through time and space to visit ancient Crete in a brilliant retelling of the Minotaur myth. Warning: The Double Axe is not for the faint-hearted!

  • Emoji Book Quiz

    Written by Matt Shenton on Jan 20, 2016

  • Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with Chris Priestley

    Written by Matt Shenton on Jan 4, 2016

    We start 2016 with a bang by going 'Beyond the Book' with the author of our favorite book of 2015!

  • 24 hour Reading Record

  • The Phoenix Hits 200th Issue!

    Written by Matt Shenton on Oct 29, 2015

  • Spooky Read – The Signalman by Charles Dickens

    Written by Matt Shenton on Oct 27, 2015

    Visited by an unnamed narrator, the signalman spends his days stuck in a dark, dank railway cutting that rarely sees light…

  • George by Alex Gino

    Written by Matt Shenton on Oct 26, 2015

    A wonderful tale of an American transgender girl who dreams of playing Charlotte the spider in a school production of Charlotte’s Web.

About

My name is Matt Shenton and I am working for Suffolk Libraries as a dedicated ‘Literacy Ambassador’ for the next year. My role is to work with schools, statutory and voluntary organisations and other interested parties to promote reading for pleasure and the importance of literacy to young people and their families in Suffolk.
